body:
No, because we want to guarantee that `this` is adjacent to `n` the specified of side. If we try to move before `n->next()`, we may move `n`.

As a concrete example, if the dependency graph looks like `this -> n -> o` then `moveBefore(o)` will end up with `this, o, n`, but `moveAfter(n)` will return false.
body_html:
No, because we want to guarantee that this is adjacent to n the specified of side. If we try to move before n->next(), we may move n.

As a concrete example, if the dependency graph looks like this -> n -> o then moveBefore(o) will end up with this, o, n, but moveAfter(n) will return false.
body_text:
No, because we want to guarantee that this is adjacent to n the specified of side. If we try to move before n->next(), we may move n.
As a concrete example, if the dependency graph looks like this -> n -> o then moveBefore(o) will end up with this, o, n, but moveAfter(n) will return false.
